item.title: ‘People Are So Proud of This’: How River and Lake Water Is Cooling Buildings
item.description: Networks of pipes and heat exchangers can transfer excess heat from buildings into nearby bodies of water—but as the world warms, the cooling potential of some water courses is now diminishing.
